Description: Function unknown, predicted permease, UPF0118 family
Comments: Null

Description: TPR-repeat lipoprotein required for OM biogenesis; in BamABCDE complex
Comments: BamD is comprised of five TPR (tetratricopeptide) repeats, the last four of which are involved in protein-protein interactions (Gatsos, 2008; Albrecht, 2011). BamD is homologous to N. gonorrhoeae competence protein ComL. The first 19 aa of BamD are a type II signal peptide. ybgF and bamD are distant paralogs. otherPDB(R. marinus):3QKY (Sandoval, 2011).

Description: DTW domain protein, function unknown
Comments: Null

Description: Protein lysine acetyltransferase
Comments: In E. coli K-12 the patA gene name mnemonic has already been used for putrescine aminotransferase, precluding its use as a primary gene name for pka(yfiQ) (Shaibe, 1985). Seven E. coli proteins, RcsB, RutR, McbR, RpsD, MltD, YcjR, and YbaB, were found to be Salmonella Pat(YfiQ) substrates modifiable by lysine acetylation in vitro using protein chips (Thao, 2010). RcsB is acetylated at Lys180 by purified E. coli Pka(YfiQ) in vitro, blocking its ability to bind to DNA, and Lys180 is deacetylated by CobB in vitro (Thao, 2010). pka(yfiQ) was named pat for protein acetyltransferase in Salmonella where it inhibits acetyl CoA synthase Acs by acetylating residue K609 (Starai, 2004). Acetyl CoA synthase (Acs) is activated by sirtuin homolog CobB-mediated deacetylation of K609 in Salmonella (Starai, 2002). More than 100 proteins have acetylated lysines in E. coli (Yu, 2008; Zhang, 2008). CobB is likely to have a limited role in general protein lysine deacetylation since only four protein bands were changed in an E. coli cobB mutant (Zhang, 2008). A deletion of pka(yfiQ) did not prevent general protein lysine acetylation of the human chemokine RANTES when cloning in E. coli BL(21); instead, non-enzymatic lysine acetylation of isolated RANTES inclusion bodies by acetyl-CoA was demonstrated and non-enzymatic processes may also be responsible for general lysine acetylation of proteins in E. coli (d'Alayer, 2007). RNase R (Rnr) is de-stabilized by proteolysis in exponential phase relative to stationary phase due to Pka-mediated acetylation of Rnr Lys544 in exponential phase only (Liang, 2011).

Protein: putative periplasmic inhibitor of YfiN activity
Description: Redox-sensitive inhibitor of DgcN actvity, periplasmic; required for swarming motility
Comments: In the E. coli UPEC strain UTI89, YfiR is a redox-sensitive, DsbA-dependent, periplasmic regulator of the diguanylate cyclase DgcN(YfiN) (Hufnagel, 2014; Hufnagel, 2017). A yfiR deletion abolishes swarming motility with only a slight effect on swimming and suppresses the swimming motility defect of yhjH mutations (Girgis, 2007). The first 22 aa of YfiR are predicted to be a type I signal peptide. The P. aeruginosa ortholog DgcN(YfiN) is an inner membrane-associated diguanylate cyclase whose activity is negatively regulated by the P. aeruginosa periplasmic protein YfiR; the P. aeruginosa OM lipoprotein YfiB counteracts YfiR inhibition of DgcN(YfiN) (Malone, 2010). YfiR might interact with the predicted N-terminal periplasmic domain of DgcN(YfiN).

Protein: cytochrome c assembly protein family inner membrane protein
Description: Cytochrome c assembly protein family inner membrane protein, function unknown; eight predicted transmembrane helices
Comments: The Salmonella YpjD ortholog was named as corE in Genbank AF130857. YpjD is homologous to cytochrome c-type biogenesis gene ccsA, magnesium-chelatase subunit gene chlI, and heme-exporter gene hemX (Pfam PF01578).

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, FimD family, interrupted by IS2I; fimbrial export usher protein family
Comments: The first 21 aa of YqiG' are predicted to be a type I signal peptide. The first ten amino acids of this reconstruction come from the other side of the IS2I insertion. Probable false positive lipoprotein prediction, Cys not conserved. YqiH (putative fimbrial chaperone), and YqiG' (putative fimbrial export usher protein) are encoded in an IS2I-interrupted putative fim operon.

Description: Predicted periplasmic fimbrial chaperone, function unknown
Comments: Probable false positive lipoprotein prediction, Cys not conserved. The first 25 aa of YqiH are a predicted type I signal peptide. YqiH has Ig-like domains: pfam PF00345 aligns to N-terminal residues 26-144, and pfam PF02753 aligns to C-terminal residues 160-227. YqiH (putative chaperone), and YqiG' (putative export usher protein) are encoded in an IS2I-interrupted putative fim operon.

Description: Fimbrial protein, required for swarm motility; also required for flagellin production and methylglyoxal resistance
Comments: The first 21 aa of YqiI are predicted to be a type I signal peptide. YqiI (fimbrial protein, PF00419), YqiH (putative chaperone), and YqiG' (putative export usher protein) are encoded in an IS2I-interrupted putative fim operon. The C-terminal domain of paralogs yqiI and ybgO may be distantly related to FimA. An insertion in yqiI confers increased sensitivity to methylglyoxal and dihydroxyacetone in a gloA mutant background; yqiI mutants have reduced flagellin and impaired motility (Kim, 2007).

Description: DUF1449 family inner membrane protein, function unknown
Comments: yqiK and yqiJ probably form an operon; PHB and NfeD/STOPP family proteins are often operonic. YqiJ was reported to be an NfeD/STOPP family protein by Chiba (2006). DUF1449 and NfeD may be part of a superfamily as a pfam Motif Scan of YqiK also hits the Nfed motif (E = 0.0029).

Protein: PHB family membrane protein, function unknown
Description: PHB family membrane protein, function unknown
Comments: yqiK and yqiJ probably form an operon; PHB and NfeD/STOPP family proteins are often operonic. YqiK overproducing cells are enlarged and contain opaque cellular inclusions (H. Plattner, University of Konstanz, unpublished data cited in Hinderhofer, 2009). The PHB domain is also called the SPFH domain, named after the proteins Stomatin, Prohibitin, Flotillin and HflK/C (Tavernarakis, 1999; Morrow, 2005; Rivera-Milla, 2006; Browman, 2007). YqiK belongs to subfamily SPFH2b (Hinderhofer, 2009).

Protein: copper/silver efflux system, outer membrane component
Description: Silver and copper efflux, OMF lipoprotein component; outer membrane factor (OMF) of a tripartate efflux pump; confers copper and silver resistance; required for invasion of brain microvascular endothelial cells in strain K1
Comments: cusC is in the cusCFBA Cu/Ag efflux operon regulated by Cu and Ag. TolC, MdtQ, MdtP and CusC are paralogs. The first 17 aa of CusC are a type II signal peptide.

Description: Silver- and cuprous copper-binding protein, periplasmic; efflux metallochaperone; confers copper and silver resistance; CusF binds both Cu(I) and Ag(I) with high affinity, but does not bind Cu(II)
Comments: Soluble periplasmic CusF binds Cu(I) specifically but weakly, probably explaining why it was not detected using Cu(I)-MIRAGE (Kittleson, 2006; Sevcenco, 2009; Sevcenco, 2012). cusF is in the cusCFBA Cu/Ag efflux operon regulated by Cu and Ag. The first 22 aa are predicted to be a type I signal peptide. However, N-terminal sequencing revealed cleavage after residue 21; the CusF clone construct had eight additional amino acids added at the N-terminus; the cleavage specificity may have been altered by the additional amino acids or the prediction is incorrect (Fanake, 2003).

Protein: copper/silver efflux system, membrane fusion protein
Description: Silver and copper efflux, membrane fusion protein; confers copper and silver resistance
Comments: cusB is in the cusCFBA Cu/Ag efflux operon regulated by Cu and Ag.

Protein: pseudogene, interrupted by IS2A; hexapeptide transferase superfamily
Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, hexapeptide transferase superfamily; interrupted by IS2A
Comments: IS2A is inserted at codon 93 of the reconstructed yaiX' and creates a 5 bp target site duplication ATTAC. An intact allele of yaiX' is present in E. coli O6:K15:H31, strain 536 (UniProtKB: Q0TGD0). A close homolog can be found in E. coli 350C1 (UniProtKB: Q9ALL4). YaiX' is homologous to glucose-1-phosphate and other acyltransferases. YaiX' belongs to the hexapeptide transferase superfamily and has 6 hexapeptide repeats.

Description: Predicted membrane-anchored cyclic-di-GMP phosphodiesterase
Comments: YlaB has an N-terminal predicted periplasmic CSS domain (PF12792) flanked by two TM segments and has a C-terminal cytoplasmic EAL PDE domain.

Description: DUF1449 family inner membrane protein, function unknown
Comments: The pfam10777 profile is based on alignments of homologs to E. coli YlaC, but is mislabeled with the function of the unrelated, YlaC sigma factor from B. subtilis. YlaC is degraded by FtsH (Arends, 2016).

Description: Maltose O-acetyltransferase
Comments: Maa contains hexapeptide repeats.

Protein: mechanosensitive channel protein, intermediate conductance, K+ regulated
Description: Mechanosensitive channel protein, intermediate (smaller, MscS-like) conductance, K+ regulated; regulation of ion balance and turgor pressure at high osmolarity; also may affect activity of mechanosensitive channel MscS
Comments: Consistently co-purifies with the degradosome. Probable false positive lipoprotein prediction, 12 CM TMs, Cys not conserved. The first 33 aa of MscK are predicted to be a type I signal peptide; the first 40 aa of MscK enable export of a fusion protein into the periplasm (McLaggan, 2002). mscS, kefA, yjeP, ybiO, ybdG and ynaI are paralogs.

Protein: regulatory protein for ClpA substrate specificity
Description: Substrate modulator for ClpAP; directs protease activity towards aggregated proteins
Comments: ClpS is needed for the degradation of N-end rule substrates by ClpAP. clpS is a non-essential gene. ClpS is homologous to eukaryotic E3 ubiquitin ligase n-recognin (Lupas, 2003).

Description: Cold shock protein G
Comments: The cspABEG deletion BX04 is cold-sensitive and forms filaments at 15C (Xia, 2001).

Description: DUF1398 family protein, function unknown
Comments: YbcV (DLP12), YdfO (Qin) and YcgX are paralogs of the DUF1398 family encoding phage and prophage proteins found exclusively in E. coli and Salmonella; ycgX is not annotated as being within a prophage but it is only two kilobases away from the e14 prophage and may be a misplaced e14 gene.

Description: e14 excisionase, in defective prophage
Comments: Null

Description: Function unknown, e14 prophage
Comments: Null

Description: Function unknown, e14 prophage
Comments: Null

Protein: e14 prophage; repressor protein phage e14
Description: CI-like repressor, e14 prophage
Comments: CohE(YmfK) is a V4I variant of a putative CI-like repressor protein from Shigella flexneri bacteriophage V.

Protein: e14 prophage; putative DNA-binding transcriptional regulator
Description: Function unknown, e14 prophage
Comments: ymfL is homologous to a protein from Shigella flexneri bacteriophage V.

Description: Function unknown, e14 prophage
Comments: Over-expression of cloned ymfM induces filamentation (Burke, 2013).

Protein: pseudogene, phage terminase protein A family, e14 prophage
Description: Pseudogene, phage terminase protein A family, e14 prophage; C-terminal fragment
Comments: Over-expression of the cloned oweE'-aaaE'(ymfN) fusion protein encoded in the K-12 chromosome induces filamentation (Burke, 2013). Full length aaaE is represented by a 577 aa lambda terminase large subunit protein A homolog EcE22_1263 of E. coli E22 (UniProtKB: B3I766). aaaE' is a C-terminal fragment missing the first 200 aa.

Protein: pseudogene, portal protein family, e14 prophage
Description: Pseudogene, N-terminal fragment, portal protein, e14 prophage
Comments: BeeE'(YmfO)' is named after the lambda portal gene B; BeeE'(YmfO)' is a member of the Pfam PF04860 Phage_portal family. Full length BeeE(YmfO) was an HK97 family portal protein now most closely represented by a 413 aa E. coli E22 protein (UniProtKB: B3I764). Phage portal dodecamers form the capsid pore for DNA packaging and extrusion and are head-tail connectors during phage assembly.

Description: Pseudogene, C-terminal fragment, baseplate, e14 prophage
Comments: JayE'(YmfP)' is named after the phage P2 baseplate assembly protein J; JayE'(YmfP)' is a member of the Pfam PF04865 Baseplate_J family and also matches IPR006949 Baseplate_assembly_J-like_pred.

Description: Putative baseplate or tail fiber protein, e14 prophage
Comments: YmfQ (COG3778, DUF2313) is related to many prophage proteins predicted to be tail proteins and is distantly related by psi-blast to gp15.1 (NCBI: SPO1_95,ACI90996) of B. subtilis phage SPO1 (NCBI: FJ230960).

Description: UPF0263 family protein
Comments: Null

Description: PHP domain protein
Comments: YciV is a PHP (Polymerase and Histidinol Phosphatase; PF02811) domain protein; YciV also matches the PHP_HisPPase_AMP (NCBI profile cd07438) subfamily with a central insert domain that is predicted to bind AMP, however the central domain of YciV does not match the AMP-binding portion of cd07438. The trpH synonym originated in the Salmonella Genbank record U92714 and had been used for E. coli yciV based on an unpublished citation in U92714: Yang,W., Bai,Q., Skrypka,I., Zhao,G. and Somerville,R.L., The 5'-upstream regions of the trp operons of Escherichia coli and Salmonella typhimurium contain divergently oriented, TrpR-controlled transcriptional units, unpublished, 1997. However, it was subsequently shown that yciV is not regulated by TrpR using trpR mutants and the inducer indole acrylate (Khodursky, 2000).

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, H repeat-associated, RhsE-linked
Comments: YhhI and YdcC are intact paralogs; a full length YncI is found in strain O157:H7 (SP: Q8X7R5). An apparent frameshift at codon 247 was hypothetically reconstructed. The YncI' stop codon 330 is marked with an X and is a Glu in O157:H7.

Description: Pseudogene, integrase homolog
Comments: Null

Description: RNase BN, tRNA processing enzyme; matures phage T4 proline, serine and isoleucine tRNAs; zinc phosphodiesterase activity
Comments: RNase BN is required for MazF-mediated cell death after inhibition of translation (Amitai, 2009). yihY was previously thought to be rbn. Rbn can work on unstructured RNA (Shibata, 2006). Rbn has both endonuclease and exonuclease activites (Asha, 1983; Ezraty, 2005; Shibata, 2006). An RNase BN defect was originally identified in a BN mutant strain that blocked the suppression of a T4 head protein mutation by T4 tRNAs (Maisurian, 1973; Seidman, 1975).

Protein: protease, capable of cleaving an AMC-ubiquitin model substrate
Description: Protease, capable of cleaving an AMC-ubiquitin model substrate; physiological substrate unknown
Comments: The elaABCD genes are named, without a phenotypic explanation, in Genbank U58768.

Description: CMD superfamily protein
Comments: The YciW N-terminal domain belongs to COG4950, which is classified in the CMD superfamily (cl00460) in the NCBI CDD database; the CMD superfamily is named for carboxymuconolactone decarboxylase. The YciW C-terminal domain belongs to COG2128, which is related to TIGRfam TIGR01926, a peroxidase-related family.

Function: Enzyme; Central intermediary metabolism: Pool, multipurpose conversions
Description: Dihydroneopterin triphosphate epimerase, tetrahydromonapterin synthesis
Comments: FolX and FolM are involved in the synthesis of tetrahydromonapterin, a major pterin that can exceed folate as an end-product of pterin biosynthesis (Pribat, 2009).

Description: Transcriptional activator for ssuEADCB and tauABCD
Comments: Adenosine 5'-phosphosulfate is probably a negative cofactor of Cbl, a sulfur starvation regulator. CysB regulon. LysR family.

Protein: nitrogen assimilation regulon transcriptional regulator; autorepressor
Description: Repressor of gdhA transcription; RpoN, GlnG(NtrC) regulons; pleiotropic effects
Comments: LysR family. Downregulated twofold by GSNO in defined medium (aerobic).

Protein: flagellar component of cell-proximal portion of basal-body rod
Description: Flagellar basal body rod subunit
Comments: Flagellar regulon.

Protein: flagellar component of cell-proximal portion of basal-body rod
Description: Flagellar basal body rod subunit
Comments: Flagellar regulon.

Description: Flagellar basal body rod modification
Comments: Flagellar regulon.

Description: Flagellar hook subunit protein
Comments: Flagellar regulon.

Protein: flagellar component of cell-proximal portion of basal-body rod
Description: Flagellar basal body rod subunit
Comments: Overexpression causes mucoidy, decreases the amount of biofilm formed, and prevents flagella formation. Flagellar regulon.

Protein: flagellar component of cell-distal portion of basal-body rod
Description: Flagellar basal body rod major subunit
Comments: Overexpression causes a decrease in the amount of biofilm formed and prevents flagella formation. Flagellar regulon.

Protein: bifunctional flagellar rod assembly protein (N-terminal) and beta-N-acetylglucosaminidase (C-terminal)
Function: Structure; Surface structures; enzyme; Murein sacculus, peptidoglycan
Description: Flagellar rod assembly protein/beta-N-acetylglucosaminidase; bifunctional; autolysin
Comments: The C-terminal domain of the orthologous Salmonella enterica FlgJ has endolytic beta-N-acetylglucosaminidase activity, not the previously proposed FlgJ murein hydrolase or lytic transglycosylase activities; the Salmonella active site residues are Glu184 and Glu223, which correspond to Glu181 and Glu220 of E. coli K-12 FlgJ; several errors in Figure 2 are confusing: (1) in 2A Glu225 not Glu223 is boxed, (2) the S. enterica FlgJ numbering from 260 on is one too few in 2A, (3) the misnumbering led to Met300 being mislabeled as Met299 in 2B and to Asp283 being misnumbered in 2A; in addition the PubMed abstract (pmid 25248745) for this paper incorrectly notes Glu233 not Glu223, as an active site residue (Herlihey, 2014). The N-terminal rod-binding domain (Pfam PF10135) of FlgJ is required for rod assembly (Minamino, 1999; Hirano, 2001). The C-terminal domain of FlgJ is required for the autolysin activity that facilitates the rod assembly function of the N-terminal domain but the activity was misinterpreted as a murein hydrolase (Dijkstra, 1996; Nambu, 1999; Hirano, 2001). Flagellar regulon.

Description: Flagellar export pore protein, integral membrane protein
Comments: Flagellar regulon.

Function: Enzyme; Degradation of small molecules: Carbon compounds
Description: 2-keto-4-pentenoate hydratase; utilizes MHP
Comments: Null

Description: Function unknown
Comments: Null

Protein: ABC transporter maintaining OM lipid asymmetry, OM lipoprotein component
Function: Transport; Transport of small molecules: phospholipids; Macromolecule synthesis, modification: Lipoprotein
Description: Phospholipid import lipoprotein, outer membrane; maintains OM lipid asymmetry; required for intercellular spreading in Shigella
Comments: Mutations in any one of the mla genes confers sensitivity to SDS-EDTA and lead to accumulation of phospholipid in the outer leaflet of the OM (Malinverni, 2009). MlaABCDEF is a predicted ABC import system that maintains outer membrane lipid asymmetry, presuambly by retrograde import of phospholipids from the outer leaflet of the OM; mla defects are suppressed by overexpression of the pldA gene encoding an OM phospholipase that removes outer leaflet phospholipids under stress conditions (Malinverni, 2009). MlaA(VacJ) of Shigella is surface-exposed (Suzuki, 1994). The first 17 aa of MlaA are a type II signal peptide.

Protein: pseudogene, CP4-6 prophage; ferric iron ABC transporter permease gene fragment
Description: Pseudogene, ferric iron ABC transporter permease; C-terminal fragment; CP4-6 putative prophage remnant
Comments: afuB is homologous to an iron-uptake system gene in Actinobacillus. afuB'(fbpA') matches the last 116 aa of an intact afuB allele in O157:H7, 692 aa Z0459 (Q8X5J2). afuB is truncated by IS1B. InterPro used the gene name fbpB for afuB, but there is already an fbp gene in K-12; additional fbp genes with different mnemonics are discouraged.

Protein: reactive chlorine species (RCS) stress resistance periplasmic protein
Description: Reactive chlorine species (RCS) stress resistance protein; predicted periplasmic protein
Comments: RclR is a reactive chlorine stress (RCS)-sensing transcriptional activator that up-regulates itself 10-fold and the divergent operon rcsABC more than 100-fold (Gray, 2013; Parker, 2013). An rclB deletion has increased hypochlorous acid (HOCl) sensitivity (Parker, 2013). The first 22 aa of RclB are predicted to be a type I signal peptide. DUF1471 family (Pfam PF07338).

Description: Inner membrane protein, DUF2755 family, function unknown
Comments: Null

Protein: DUF2754 family putative inner membrane protein
Description: Predicted inner membrane protein, DUF2754 family; function unknown
Comments: Null

Protein: stress protein, member of the CspA-family
Description: Cold shock protein homolog, not cold-inducible
Comments: Null

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, C-terminal fragment, PF10971 family
Comments: An intact 759 aa version of YkiA is present in E. coli B185 (UniProtKB:D6I6K1). Intact versions of YkiA are also found in E. coli strains O157:H7, O55:H7 and TW10509, annotated as 721 aa proteins although their predicted signal peptides are encoded in the upstream DNA. Many E. coli strains, including K-12, contain trucated pseudogene C-terminal forms of YkiA, usually annotated as intact genes starting at an in-frame TTG, giving a protein sequence of 93 aa; however an additional 20 aa encoded upstream of these pseudogenes matches the intact alleles. Intact YkiA and YdbD are predicted secreted proteins that are paralogous. The intact YkiA alleles are predicted to have 22 aa type I signal peptides.

Description: Function unknown, CP4-6 putative prophage remnant
Comments: Null

Protein: CP4-57 prophage; toxin of the YpjF-YfjZ toxin-antitoxin system
Description: Toxin component of putative toxin-antitoxin pair YpjF-YfjZ; CP4-57 prophage
Comments: ykfI, ypjF and yeeV are paralogs. Cloned, induced ypfJ does not inhibit growth due to lack of stable protein expression; FLAG-tagged YpfJ is stabilized and does inhibit growth slightly (Brown, 2003).

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, discontinuous N-terminal fragment
Comments: A missing internal fragment causes a frameshift at codon 120, reconstructed with an X.

Description: Homolog of phage lamdba nin, DLP12 prophage
Comments: Null

Protein: peroxide and acid resistance protein, UPF0434 family
Description: UPF0434 family, low abundance protein; function unknown
Comments: Null

Protein: RcsB connector protein for regulation of biofilm and acid-resistance
Description: Connector protein for RcsB regulation of biofilm and acid-resistance; blue light, low temperature and stress induction, BluRF(YcgEF) and RpoS regulons
Comments: Blue light activation of the BluF(YgcF) anti-repressor relieves BluR(YcgE) repression of the cold-shock RpoS-activated small protein operon ycgZ-ymgA-ariR-ymgC operon; connector proteins AirR(YmgB) (at 28C) and YmgA (at 16C) stimulate colanic acid synthesis and inhibit curli production by an RcsA-independent activation of RcsB; RcsB activation is antagonized by connector protein YcgZ (Tschowri, 2009). ycgZ is induced three hours after cold shock in a pnp-dependent manner. Overexpression of YcgZ allows for growth on D-Raffinose as he soel carbon source (Notebaart, 2014).

Protein: RcsB connector protein for regulation of biofilm
Description: Connector protein for RcsB regulation of biofilm; blue light, low temperature and stress induction, BluRF(YcgEF) and RpoS regulons
Comments: Blue light activation of the BluF(YgcF) anti-repressor relieves BluR(YcgE) repression of the cold-shock RpoS-activated small protein operon ycgZ-ymgA-ariR-ymgC operon; connector proteins AirR(YmgB) (at 28C) and YmgA (at 16C) stimulate colanic acid synthesis and inhibit curli production by an RcsA-independent activation of RcsB; RcsB activation is antagonized by connector protein YcgZ (Tschowri, 2009).

Protein: RcsB connector protein for regulation of biofilm and acid-resistance
Description: Connector protein for RcsB regulation of biofilm and acid-resistance
Comments: AriR(YmgB) is a global regulator that is upregulated by cytoplasmic pH stress (Kannan, 2008). AriR(YmgA) mediates the 5-fluorouracil represssion of biofilm formation (Attila, 2009). Blue light activation of the BluF(YgcF) anti-repressor relieves BluR(YcgE) repression of the cold-shock RpoS-activated small protein operon ycgZ-ymgA-ariR-ymgC operon; connector proteins AirR(YmgB) (at 28C) and YmgA (at 16C) stimulate colanic acid synthesis and inhibit curli production by an RcsA-independent activation of RcsB; RcsB activation is antagonized by connector protein YcgZ (Tschowri, 2009). AirR(YmgB) stimulates acid resistance genes (Tschowri, 2009). AirR(YmgB), YmgA and YcgZ are connector proteins, small proteins which influence the activity of specific two-component systems (Tschowri, 2009). AriR may be a dimeric DNA binding protein. AriR is blue light, low temperature and stress inducible and in the BluRF(YcgEF) and RpoS regulons.

Protein: blue light, low temperature and stress induced protein
Description: Blue light, low temperature and stress induced, function unknown; BluRF(YcgEF) and RpoS regulons
Comments: Blue light activation of the BluF(YgcF) anti-repressor relieves BluR(YcgE) repression of the cold-shock RpoS-activated small protein operon ycgZ-ymgA-ariR-ymgC operon (Tschowri, 2009).

Description: Periplasmic protein, HdeA structural homolog, function unknown
Comments: YmgD is either not an acid-activated chaperone like HdeA or activation does not require unfolding (Socher, 2016). The first 19 aa of YmgD are predicted to be a type I signal peptide.

Description: Inner membrane protein, Salmonella sirB2 ortholog, function unknown
Comments: YchQ(SirB2) of Salmonella upregulates sirC expression, but E. coli K-12 does not have sirC ortholog (Rakeman, 1999).

Protein: DUF2534 family putative inner membrane protein
Description: Predicted inner membrane protein, DUF2534 family, function unknown
Comments: ArcA binds and repressses the ynaJ promoter (Federowicz, 2014).

Description: DUF2543 family protein, function unknown
Comments: Null

Description: Blue light induced, function unknown, Rac prophage; BluRF(YcgEF) regulon
Comments: Blue light activation of the BluF(YgcF) anti-repressor relieves BluR(YcgE) repression of ynaK (Tschowri, 2009).

Description: Novel verified lipoprotein, function unknown
Comments: First 16 aa are a type II signal peptide.

Description: Ring 1,2-phenylacetyl-CoA epoxidase subunit; phenylacetyl-CoA oxygenase, effector protein; phenylacetic acid degradation
Comments: PaaABCDE is a multi-subunit oxygenase that hydroxylates phenylacetyl-CoA. PaaABCE is purified without PaaD and added PaaD is not required for the formation of ring 1,2-epoxy-phentylacetate-CoA by the PaaABCE monooxygenease (Teufel, 2010).

Description: DUF2554 family protein with a predicted signal peptide
Comments: The deletion of yncJ confers resistance to chlorhexadine diacetate, which targets electron transport (Raivio, 2013). Cpx regulon. The first 22 aa of YncJ are predicted to be a type I signal peptide.

Description: Osmoresponsive gene with reduced expression in biofilms; function unknown
Comments: Overexpression of Bdm results in more efficient biofilm formation (Sim, 2009). The yddX gene is renamed bdm and the site of the MudX insertion is between the T and the G of the re-annotated ATG start codon (Philippe Lejeune, INSA, France, personal communication, Oct. 1999).

Description: Putative small toxic membrane polypeptide; homologous to plasmid-encoded plasmid stabilization toxins regulated by antisense RNA; regulatory antisense sRNA antitoxin is SokE
Comments: Although sokE and hokE are intact, the start of the regulatory peptide gene mokE is missing from this remnant hok/mok locus, so the mokE (and hence hokE) is not expressed and the frame cannot be determined to annotate a pseudogene. LexA regulon. IS186B is inserted downstream of the hokE gene in K-12.

Protein: nucleoid-associated oriC-binding protein; H-NS and StpA stabilizing factor
Description: Nucleoid-associated oriC-binding protein; H-NS and StpA stabilizing factor
Comments: The Cnu(YdgT)-HN-S and Cnu(YdgT)-StpA complexes are protected from Lon degradation (Paytubi, 2004). Cnu is nucleoid-associated oriC-binding protein that binds to a 26 bp cnb site that partially overlaps a DnaA-binding site (Kim, 2005). Cnu is an HHA family (Pfam PF05321) protein.

Description: Novel verified lipoprotein, function unknown
Comments: First 16 aa are a type II signal peptide.

Description: Stress-induced protein, function unknown; involved in cadmium and peroxide resistance
Comments: The yeaR-yoaG operon is nitrate-regulated, primarily anaerobically, and is in the NarL and NsrR regulons (Constantinidou, 2006; Hsia-Yin, 2007). yeaR-yoaG regulation is FNR-independent (Constantinidou, 2006; Hsia-Yin, 2007). A yoaG mutant strain is sensitive to hydrogen peroxide and cadmium (Lee, 2009).

Description: UPF0181 family protein, function unknown
Comments: Null

Description: Function unknown
Comments: Null

Protein: CP4-44 prophage; putative disrupted hemin or colicin receptor
Description: Pseudogene, frameshift, 3' deletion; CP4-44 putative defective prophage
Comments: yoeA' is interrupted by IS2F after codon 103; an intact YoeA allele is present in O157:H6 as Z3159, annotated as a 719 aa protein, but Met-5 is used as the start site because of a much better RBS, so this trucated frameshifted pseudogene represents the first 167 of 715 amino acids.

Protein: pseudogene, gpD phage P2-like protein D
Description: Pseudogene, gpD phage P2-like protein D; C-terminal fragment
Comments: EvgAS regulon. yegZ is adjacent to the ogrK copy of the P2 ogr gene, indicating the presence of a P2-like prophage remnant. Intact alleles are present in several E. coli strains and Yersinia pestis phage L-413C (UniProtKB: Q858U5).

Description: Pseudogene, predicted DNA-invertase fragment
Comments: pinH' may be a remnant of the nearby CP4-57 prophage.

Description: UPF0057 protein, cyaR sRNA-regulated
Comments: Deletion of ygaE confers resistance to various antibiotic compounds, including oxycarboxin, trifluoperazine, salicylate, PMSF, and the cell wall inhibitors cefoxitin and oxacillin (Raivio, 2013). YqaE is regulated by cyaR sRNA post-transcriptionally (De Lay, 2009). YqaE is a predicted membrane protein. Cpx regulon.

Description: Uncharacterized protein, function unknown
Comments: YqjK is the prototype for a family of proteins of unknown function (PF13997).

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, Rac prophage lom homolog; outer membrane protein interrupted by IS5Y, missing N-terminus
Comments: lomR' is a truncated phage lambda lom gene homolog missing the first 68 codons, present in the Rac prophage. Z3310 is a full length lomR allele encoding a 199 aa LomR protein from E. coli O157:H7.

Description: Function unknown, possible secreted protein or lipoprotein
Comments: YecT is predicted by PATOSEQ, but not LipoP, to have a 13 aa type II signal peptide. First 18 aa are also predicted to be a type I signal peptide. Alternative TTG start at codon -7 could be translation start.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, tail fiber assembly gene, DLP12 prophage; C-terminal fragment
Comments: tfaX is a second C-terminal tail fiber assembly pseudogene gene in DLP12 in addition to tfaD. A stop codon at position 36 is translated as an X.

Description: Ferredoxin-like protein, function unknown
Comments: Null

Description: TDP-Fuc4NAc:Lipid II transferase; needed for ECA (enterobacterial common antigen) synthesis
Comments: Null

Description: Putative carboxymethylenebutenolidase; dienelactone hydrolase homolog, function unknown
Comments: S9 peptidase family.

Description: Protein translocase, Sec-independent; mediates export of folded and ligand-bound proteins
Comments: Forms a complex with TatAC.

Description: UPF0153 cysteine cluster protein, function unknown
Comments: YcgN, YkgJ and YeiW are members of the UPF0153 family and have multiple conserved Cys residues, including an N-terminal CXX(X)CGXCC motif that may be involved in metal binding. The UPF0153 family matches the Pfam PF03692 profile that appears to have been mislabeled as a FliB profile.

Protein: putative transcriptional regulator for the ecp operon
Description: Putative transcriptional regulator for the ecp operon
Comments: The O18ac:K1:H7 NMEC ecpRAB(matABC) genes are required for E. coli common pilus (Mat fimbria) formation when cloned in K-12; ecpR(matA) mRNA was detected in K-12, but not ecpAB(matBC) mRNA (Pouttu, 2001). LuxR family.

Description: Function unknown
Comments: Null

Protein: 50S ribosomal protein L31 type B; alternative zinc-limitation L31 protein
Description: 50S ribosomal protein L31 type B; alternative L31 utilized during zinc limitation
Comments: YkgM(RpmE2) is homologous to ribosomal protein L31, but lacks a zinc binding ribbon domain. ykgM is up-regulated by Zn(2+) depletion and and a ykgM mutant grows poorly under Zn(2+) limited conditions (Graham, 2009). YkgM may substitute for RpmE under zinc starvation conditions since it does not bind zinc, allowing displaced RpmE to be degraded to salvage its bound zinc (Panina, 2003; Graham, 2009). Zur regulon.

Protein: pseudogene, Rhs family C-terminal fragment with unique putative toxin domain
Description: Pseudogene, Rhs family C-terminal fragment with unique putative toxin domain; rhsC-linked
Comments: Null

Protein: AcrAB-TolC efflux pump accessory protein, membrane-associated
Description: AcrAB-TolC efflux pump accessory protein, membrane-associated
Comments: AcrZ(YbhT) is an accessory factor stabilizing or modulating the acrAB-TolC efflux pump through AcrB binding (Hobbs, 2012).

Protein: cytochrome d (bd-I) ubiquinol oxidase subunit X
Description: Cytochrome d (bd-I) ubiquinol oxidase subunit X; required for CydAB activity
Comments: CydX(YbgT) binds to CydAB and is required for full cytochrome bd-I activity in cells; overproduced CbdX(AppX) can substitute for CydX in vivo (Vanorsdel; 2013). CydX(YbgT) and CbdX(AppX) are in cytochrome oxidase operons and have conserved cysteines that might help coordinate heme groups, although substitution C14S was functional, belying this proposition (Sun, 2012; Vanorsdel; 2013). YbgT was expressed in minicells at high temperature as a ~4 kDa protein, with no evidence of type I signal cleavage (Muller, 1997). Overexpression causes abnormal biofilm architecture and reduced motility. A false positive predicted 23 aa signal peptide cleavage would leave a 14 aa mature protein. cbdX(appX) and cydX(ybgT) are homologs.

Description: Function unknown, CP4-57 putative defective prophage
Comments: Null

Protein: CP4-6 prophage; RadC-like JAB domain protein
Description: Function unknown, CP4-6 putative prophage remnant
Comments: Null

Description: Function unknown, CP4-6 putative prophage remnant
Comments: Null

Protein: CP4-6 prophage; toxin of the YkfI-YafW toxin-antitoxin system
Description: Toxin component of toxin-antitoxin protein pair YkfI-YafW; CP4-6 prophage
Comments: Over-expression of cloned ykfI induces filamentation (Burke, 2013). ykfI, ypjF and yeeV are paralogs. YkfI overexpression inhibits growth (Brown, 2003).

Description: Expressed protein, function unknown
Comments: Null

Description: Repressor of biofilm formation by indole transport regulation; global regulator, e.g. of AI-2 transport and motility genes; cold shock gene
Comments: BssS increases Mtr expression and indole import; BssS decreases AcrEF expression and indole export (Domka, 2006). bssS is specifically induced during mature biofilm formation (if the F plasmid is present), but is not induced in stationary phase; mutants have normal early biofilm adhesion as assayed in mictotiter plate assay but have reduced mature biofilm formation (in contrast to later work) (Beloin, 2004). bssS(yceP) is induced three hours after cold shock in a pnp-dependent manner (Polissi, 2003). YhaJ binds and activates promoters for yqjF, ybiJ, yhaK, ygiD, yhhW, as well as bssS(yceP) to a lesser degree; these YhaJ-regulated genes are proposed to constitute a novel quinol-like compound degradation regulon (Palevsky, 2016).

Description: Function unknown, e14 prophage
Comments: YmfR is a conserved 60 aa phage protein of unknown function that is located between terminase and portal genes of e14, a position and length that is analagous to the 68 aa lambda W head-tail joining protein (NCBI: 9626246) that works with the lambda portal protein. The lambda W protein NMR structure (PDB: 1HYW) is known and it is has an alpha-beta-alpha structure just as predicted (Maxwell, 2001). However YmfR is predicted to just be alpha-alpha structure.

Description: Predicted tail fiber assembly gene, e14 prophage
Comments: tfaP is expectd to be transcriptionally silenced in the P-element P(-) orientation, although is may not be expressed and is not expected to be functional even if expressed since e14 does not produce infective virions (Plasterk, 1984; Mehta, 2005).

Protein: UPF0410 family putative inner membrane protein
Description: UPF0410 family predicted inner membrane protein; function unknown
Comments: The UPF0410 family is described as a family containing some transglycosylase associated proteins (Pfam PF04226) but the source of this annotation is unclear. YmgE has three predicted transmembrane helicies.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, PemK toxin family protein
Comments: YifN' is a PemK toxin family protein (PF02452); a corresponding PemI family antitoxin has apparently been deleted, probably explaining why yifN' has acquired a frameshift mutation. An apparent frameshift at codon 70 of yifN' has been hypothetically reconstructed. An intact version of YifN is present in E. coli O157:H7 as Z5287, with an alternative start.

Description: UPF0174 family protein; mutation increases biofilm formation
Comments: yaaW orthologs are present in many bacterial genomes and yaaW is the second gene in the putative yaaIW operon. An ORF antisense to yaaW, referred to as htgA or htpY, has been described as having a high temperature survival function and as being subject to heat-induced gene expression (Dean, 1991; James, 1993; Missiakas, 1993). Evidence supporting the expression of the putative antisense ORF htgA(htpY) in vivo has been presented, although this has never been reproduced (Missiakas, 1993). A yaaW/htgA deletion mutant displays 3-fold increased biofilm production (Domka, 2007). Although there may be an asRNA on the opposite strand of yaaW (asRNA-yaaW), its functional relevance should not be assumed. A comprehensive characterization of the E. coli K-12 heat shock response found no evidence supporting heat shock-induction or RpoH-dependent in vitro transcription of the proposed htgA(htpY) gene (Nonaka, 2006). The antisense ORF opposing yaaW is not conserved and has an unusual amino acid composition. Long antisense ORFs occur often in the E. coli K-12 genome and are not considered to be likely protein-coding genes (Borodovsky, 1994). Skepticism is warranted when predicting long overlapping protein-coding genes in the E. coli K-12 genome as not a single case has yet been proven; actual translation should be experimentally demonstrated unequivocally. GFP transcriptional fusions to both yaaW and asRNA-yaaW were active; 5'-RACE was used to map the yaaW and asRNA-yaaW transcription start points (Fellner, 2013). The asRNA-yaaW ORF was proposed to be a functional protein-coding gene, but attempts to demonstrate production of an asRNA-encoded protein failed (Fellner, 2013). Nonsense mutations were specifically introduced, but not DNA sequence-confirmed, into the asRNA-yaaW ORF (referred to as mbiA) and yaaW in a manner preserving the amino acid sequences encoded in the opposite strand; slightly increased biofilm production was reported for both mutants, however no nonsense suppression or trans-complementation experiments were described, leaving reasonable doubt about the conclusion that the asRNA-yaaW ORF encodes a protein product (Fellner, 2013). yaaW-asRNA transcription has been detected in various microarray studies and appears to be subject to transcriptional regulation different than that of yaaW, but microarray data does not provide evidence for the translation of mbiA into a protein. A conclusive experimental demonstration of asRNA-yaaW translation has not yet been published that would warrant annotating the putative asRNA-YaaW ORF as a functional protein-coding gene.

Description: Inner membrane division septum protein, function unknown; binds FtsL, FtsI and FtsQ
Comments: YmfG has two transmembrane segments and localizes to the division septum, dependent on FtsZ, FtsA, FtsQ, and FtsN (Karimova, 2009). Overexpression of YmgF suppresses an ftsQ TS mutant (Karimova, 2009).

Protein: toxin of GhoTS toxin-antitoxin pair; membrane-lytic protein; stimulator of persister cell formation
Description: Toxin of GhoTS toxin-antitoxin pair; membrane-lytic protein; stimulator of persister cell formation
Comments: The GhoT(YjdO) toxin is a membrane-lytic protein that produces 60% non-viable ghost cells when overproduced and increases the formation of persister cells among the survivors; the GhoST toxin-antitoxin pair is proposed to define a new class of TA pairs, named type V, because the GhoS(YjdK) antitoxin is an RNase that cleaves the toxin mRNA; the NMR structure of GhoS (PDB:2LLZ) resembles the Cas2 RNase of the CRISPR system (Wang, 2012; Van Melderen, 2012). Toxin endoribonuclease MqsR degrades ghoS antitoxin mRNA but not ghoT toxin mRNA, amplifying the GhoT toxin production as a stress response (Wang, 2013). MqsR induction increases GhoT production; GhoT is localized to poles and does not cause cell lysis during normal physiology but does impair membrane function, causing a reduction of cellular ATP and PMF energy sources, a lowered metabolism, and an increase in the number of persistent (dormant) cells formed in the presence of antibiotics (Cheng, 2013).

Protein: putative enzyme IIB component of PTS
Description: Predicted phosphotransferase enzyme IIB, function unknown
Comments: Null

Protein: undecaprenyl phosphate-alpha-L-ara4N exporter; flippase ArnEF subunit
Function: Transport; Transport of small molecules: lipids
Description: Undecaprenyl phosphate-alpha-L-ara4N exporter; flippase ArnEF subunit
Comments: Export via ArnEF is required for the modification of lipid A phosphates with aminoarabinose that is needed for polymyxin B and cationic antimicrobial peptide resistance (Yan, 2007). ArnEF is also known as the probable 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose(Ara4N)-phosphoundecaprenol flippase. The arnBCADTEF operon promoter region binds FNR and arnBCADTEF expression is repressed by FNR (Federowicz, 2014).

Description: Bacteriolytic lipoprotein entericidin B toxin
Comments: The first 21 aa of EcnB are a type II signal peptide.

Protein: pseudogene; DLP12 prophage; tail fiber assembly protein family
Description: Pseudogene, phage terminase protein A homolog, DLP12 prophage; N-terminal fragment,
Comments: AaaD' is identical to the first 103 aa of bacteriophage lambda terminase large subunit DNA packaging protein A (GpA) (UniProtKB: P03708).

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, rhsA-linked rhs gene fragment
Comments: Four stop codons (3, 11, 25, 27) were translated as Xs.

Description: Pseudogene, internal fragment, Rhs family protein
Comments: The ylbI internal fragment is N-terminal, but missing the start codon.

Description: Function unknown
Comments: Null

Description: Uncharacterized small protein
Comments: YciX has homologs in closely related species including Salmonella and Citrobacter. Residues 33-49 of YciX are predicted to be alpha-helical, constitute the most conserved segment of the protein, and have a weak (possibly spurious) hit (E = 0.02) to the PRK04307 profile using NCBI CD-Search; PRK04307 proteins belong to the DsbB superfamily of disulfide oxidoreductases, but the two YciX Cys residues are not conserved making it unlikely that YciX acts as a disulfide oxidoreductase.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, C-terminal fragment, yedZ paralog
Comments: Stop codon 76 is translated as an X. A frameshift at codon 33 was hypothetically reconstructed with an X. Although there are many yrdE' pseudogenes in other E. coli strains, there is currently no intact copy of yrdE sequenced.

Protein: stimulator of EntF adenylation activity, MbtH-like
Function: Enzyme; Biosynthesis of cofactors, carriers: Enterochelin
Description: Stimulator of EntF adenylation activity, MbtH-like protein; enterochelin synthesis
Comments: The adenylation activity of EntF is stimulated by the co-purifying MbtH-like protein YbdZ; the affinity of EntF for L-serine was improved 15-fold in the presence of YbdZ (Felnagle, 2010). A ybdZ mutant has a growth defect under iron starvation (Felnagle, 2010). YbdZ can cross-activate heterologous amino acid adenylation enzymes, which should be co-expressed with their cognate MbtH-like proteins in a ybdZ mutant host (Felnagle, 2010; Boll, 2011). OtherPDB (M. tuberculosis): 2KHR. OtherPDB (B. pseudomallei): 2LPD. OtherPDB (P. aeruginosa): 2PST. DUF1922 family protein.

Description: Expressed protein, function unknown, DLP12 prophage
Comments: ATG at codon 7 could also be the start codon. YlcG is homologous to ORF45 of bacteriophage 82 (UniProtKB: Q37874).

Description: Uncharacterized protein, DLP12 prophage
Comments: Immunoblots of chromosomal SPA-tagged YlcH failed to show a band, indicating that if ylcH is a gene, it is not expressed under the conditions tested (Hemm, 2008).

Protein: toxin of the YoeB-YefM toxin-antitoxin system
Description: Toxin in the YefM-YoeB toxin/antitoxin pair; has in vitro RNase activity
Comments: YefM-YoeB is the only toxin/antoxin pair involved in Lon dependent lethality. Homologous to Enterococcus faecium Txe toxin.

Description: Pseudogene, C-terminal fragment; ancestral gene related to fabD (malonyl-CoA-acyl carrier protein transacylase)
Comments: Null

Description: KGG family protein
Comments: ymdF and yciG are paralogs. YciG and YmdF are similar to small stress proteins (KGG family, PF10685) including GsiB of B. subtilis and yciG is regulated by RpoS.

Function: IS, phage, Tn; Transposon-related functions; extrachromosomal; transposon related
Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, IS609 transposase A
Comments: InsP' belongs to the COG1943/pfam01797 (Transposase_17) family. An in-frame stop codon at 1501382 (codon 96) is ignored to reconstruct this protein sequence; a conserved stop codon at the end of the gene has been mutated (TAG to CAG), so it is not translated in the reconstructed pseudogene protein sequence.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, C-terminal fragment, AraC family
Comments: An apparent frameshift at codon 38 has been hypothetically reconstructed wth an X.

Description: Pseudogene, CP4-44 putative defective prophage; C-terminal fragment of a putative transposase
Comments: An example of an intact allele is Z4340 of strain O157:H7.

Protein: immediate sulfur donor in thiazole formation
Function: Factor; Biosynthesis of cofactors, carriers: Thiamine
Description: Immediate sulfur donor in thiazole formation; C-terminal thiocarboxylate; ThiF-ThiS complex
Comments: The ThiS N-terminus has been verified by MS/MS sequencing, the Met is not clipped and the measured mass is 7310.74 (Kelleher, 1998).

Description: DUF2387 family predicted metal-binding protein; function unknown
Comments: Null

Description: DUF3820 family protein, function unknown
Comments: Null

Description: Phosphatidylglycerol kinase, metal-dependent
Comments: Lipid kinase activity demonstrated in vitro; physiological role uncertain (Bakali, 2007). Homologous to diacylglycerol kinase.

Description: Pseudogene, N-terminal fragment
Comments: ykfJ encodes the first 69 aa of a predicted 379 aa protein. An intact allele is in F11 (Q8FKN0). The same deletion event apparently removed a 3' part of ykfJ and a 5' part of prfH, which are intact and adjacent in other E. coli genomes.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, N-terminal fragment; putative cryptic immunity protein; HEAT domain protein
Comments: YrhC' is almost identical to the YibA HEAT-domain lethality reduction protein that is the predicted immunity protein for polymorphic toxin RhsA. YrhC' is an N-terminal fragment and has an in-frame stop codon at codon 82 that is translated as an X but encodes Lys in YibA.

Protein: entericidin A membrane lipoprotein, antidote entericidin B
Description: Lipoprotein antitoxin to bacteriolytic lipoprotein entericidin B (ecnB) toxin
Comments: The first 18 aa of EcnA are a type II signal peptide.

Protein: glucitol/sorbitol-specific enzyme IIB component of PTS
Function: Transport; Transport of small molecules: Carbohydrates, organic acids, alcohols
Description: Sorbitol-specific enzyme IIB component of PTS
Comments: Glucitol is a less common synonym for sorbitol.

Description: ABC exporter permease-ATPase, function unknown
Comments: Although MdlAB are similar to multidrug exporters, no overexpression resistances were found. mdlA and mdlB were fused by a frameshift mutation or sequencing error in the original report.

Description: UPF0153 cysteine cluster protein, function unknown
Comments: YcgN, YkgJ and YeiW are members of the UPF0153 family and have multiple conserved Cys residues, including an N-terminal CXX(X)CGXCC motif that may be involved in metal binding. The UPF0153 family matches the Pfam PF03692 profile that appears to have been mislabeled as a FliB profile.

Protein: putative lipoprotein involved in colanic acid biosynthesis
Description: Colanic acid synthesis protein; possible lipoprotein
Comments: RcsA, but not RcsF, is necessary for YpdI-dependent colanic acid synthesis. First 18 aa are predicted to be a type II signal peptide. First 23 aa are also predicted to be a type I signal peptide. E. coli-only protein.

Protein: CP4-6 prophage; putative DNA-binding transcriptional regulator
Description: Pseudogene, N-terminal fragment, CP4-6 putative prophage remnant
Comments: ykfK is identical to the first 64 amino acids of the conserved, full length allelic gene yfjR, encoded a predicted HTH transcriptional regulator.

Description: Pseudogene, C-terminal fragment, CP4-6 putative prophage remnant
Comments: YkfL is very similar to YpjK of the CP4-57 putative prophage remnant, but appears to be missing the N-terminus. There are no homologs, so it is unclear if ypjK is a real gene, but it does have a very strong RBS.

Protein: CP4-57 prophage; putative inner membrane protein
Description: Function unknown, CP4-57 putative defective prophage
Comments: YpjK is similar to YkfL of the CP4-6 prophage remnant.

Description: Probable Rz1-like lipoprotein, DLP12 prophage
Comments: Phage lambda Rz1 protein homolog. The first 19 aa of RzoD are predicted to be a type II signal peptide. rzoD is completed embedded in the +1 frame of rzpD.

Description: Probable Rz1-like lipoprotein, Rac prophage
Comments: Phage lambda Rz1 protein homolog. The first 19 aa of RzoR are predicted to be a type II signal peptide. rzoR is completed embedded in the +1 frame of the rzpR' pseudogene.

Description: DUF2527 family heat-induced protein, function unknown
Comments: YobF is a post-transcriptionally regulated stationary phase heat shock protein (Hemm, 2008; Hemm, 2010). YobF is expressed during biofilm formation (Ren, 2004). YobF expression is repressed by OxyS overexpression (Tjaden, 2006).

Protein: regulatory peptide for PhoPQ, feedback inhibition
Description: Negative feedback regulator for PhoPQ regulon, membrane-bound
Comments: MgrB is an uncleaved small membrane peptide that can bind to PhoQ and can inhibit PhoPQ signaling, mediating feedback control of the PhoPQ regulon (Lippa, 2009). Mg(2+) stimulon-PhoPQ regulon. EvgAS-PhoPQ cascade enhanced-expression subset. False-positive lipoprotein (type II) and type I signal peptide signatures.

Description: DUF2502 family putative periplasmic protein; function unknown
Comments: yaaX expression is upregulated by colicin M (Kamen≈°ek, 2013). yaaX was identified as a gene involved in cell wall precursor metabolism (Paradis-Bleau, 2014). The first 23 aa of YaaX are predicted to be a type I signal peptide. ypeC and yaaX are paralogs. The C-terminal half of YaaX is His- and Pro-rich, including five prolines in a row.

Description: DUF2502 family putative periplasmic protein; function unknown
Comments: The first 21 aa of YpeC are predicted to be a type I signal peptide. ypeC and yaaX are paralogs.

Description: Function unknown
Comments: YaaY has an N-terminal lipobox LAGC, but does not have the other features characteristic of a signal peptide and is probably not a lipoprotein. EC-ST only.

Description: Peroxide and acid resistance protein, stress-induced
Comments: A yodD mutant strain is sensitive to hydrogen peroxide and acid (Lee, 2009).

Description: Cold shock-induced protein, function unknown, Qin prophage
Comments: ynfN shows some similarity to the N-terminus of the transposition proteinTniB. ynfN is transiently induced after a cold shock. Possible pseudogene remnant.

Protein: beta-lactam resistance membrane protein; divisome-associated protein
Description: Beta-lactam resistance protein; divisome-associated membrane protein; multi-copy suppressor of ftsQ1(Ts)
Comments: Blr localizes to the division septum and associates with FtsL,FtsI, FtsK, FtsN, FtsQ, FtsW, and YmgF; blr is a multi-copy suppressor of ftsQ1(Ts), obviating the need for salt-suppression of ftsQ1; blr mutations exacerbate the ftsQ1 phenotype (Karimova, 2012).

Description: Uncharacterized protein
Comments: YciY is present on a ~250 nt mRNA expressed in both rich and minimal media (Wassarman, 2001). YciY homologs are present in many enterobacterial genomes.

Protein: stress-induced small inner membrane enterobacterial protein
Description: Small inner membrane stress-induced enterobacterial protein; function unknown
Comments: YncL is a stationary phase-induced small inner membrane heat shock protein of unknown function (Wassarman, 2001; Hemm; 2008: Alix, 2009; Hemm, 2010; Hobbs, 2011; Fontaine, 2011). The yncL-ydcXY divergent operon promoter region binds FNR (Federowicz, 2014). YncL orthologs are present in E. coli, Salmonella, Klebsiella, and Enterobacter genomes.

Description: Expressed protein, membrane-associated, function unknown; regulated by PhoPQ and Mg(2+)
Comments: The sRNA mgrR and the adjacent converging protein gene yneM are conserved and are also expressed in Salmonella (Sittka, 2008). The 5' end of the yneM mRNA was mapped (Moon, 2009).

Description: Stress-induced enterobacterial small protein, function unknown
Comments: YncL is a stationary phase-induced small inner membrane heat shock protein of unknown function (Wassarman, 2001; Hemm; 2008; Hemm, 2010). ypfM was identified during a hunt for new sRNA genes because it displays a variable third position conservation pattern indicative of a coding region (Wassarman, 2001). YpfM orthologs are present in various enterobacterial genomes.

Description: Function unknown; homologs in Salmonella, Klebsiella, and Yersinia
Comments: Null

Description: Function unknown; homologs widespread in Bacteria
Comments: Null

Description: Predicted membrane protein, UPF0370 family, function unknown
Comments: There are YpfN homologs in Salmonella, Yersinia and other bacteria.

Description: Possible lipoprotein, function unknown
Comments: The first 17 aa of YsaB are predicted to be a type II signal peptide, but there is no charged residue. YsaB is homologous to S. typhimurium STM3657 (SP Q8ZL94). EC-ST-only.

Protein: putative inner membrane efflux pump-associated DUF1656 family protein
Description: DUF1656 family predicted inner membrane protein; efflux pump associated; function unknown; possible lipoprotein
Comments: YtcA, AaeX and YdhI are DUF1656 family (Pfam PF07869) predicted inner membrane proteins; all these E. coli DUF1656 family proteins are encoded in the first genes of known or predicted efflux pump operons, preceding the membrane fusion protein genes.

Protein: toxic membrane persister formation peptide, LexA-regulated
Description: Toxin involved in persister formation, LexA regulon; membrane peptide that decreases proton motive force and ATP levels; expression regulated by the divergent istR-1 sRNA antitoxin
Comments: TisB is required to form multidrug-resistant persister cells in response to treatment with ciprofloxacin, an antibiotic that causes DNA damage (Dorr, 2010). A ~400 bp LexA-regulated mRNA covering tisB has been observed in Northern blots (De Henestrosa et al, 2000). lstR-1 mediates antisense inhibition of TisB translation and this inhibition may be mitigated during the SOS response by the the istR-2 sRNA which has a LexA-regulated promoter upstream of the IstR-1 promoter (Vogel, 2004). The antisense sRNA IstR-1 binds to and blocks an upstream ribosome loading standby site required for translation initiation of TisB; ribosomes probably slide to the highly structured downstream TIR after loading; this results in RNase III cleavage of the active, processed +42 tisB mRNA to form an inactive +106 tisB mRNA (Darfeuille, 2007). Overexpression of tisB mRNA inhibits the SOS response including UV sensitivity and a delayed induction of recA; TisB toxin is implicated by two internal sense-to-nonsense mutations that cause premature translation termination and abolish the SOS inhibition, however a start codon mutation with normal amounts of tisB RNA does not block the effect, indicating that the TisB toxin may not be the effector; the unprocessed tisB pre-mRNA functions as an antisense RNA regulator of uxaA, resulting in cleavage of uxaA mRNA at the antisense site and also reciprocal cleavage and activation of the tisB pre-mRNA (forming the +42 tisB RNA); the tisB pre-RNA probably regulates dinD translation also; the tisB SOS defect is dependent on the presence of the uxaA antisense target and the dinD putative antisense target (Weel-Sneve, 2008). Although plasmid mutations indicate TisB is expressible, chromosomal expression has not been detected. The internal stop codon TisB mutations may block the SOS inhibition by reducing the amount of tisB pre-RNA present (which was not measured) and that the pre-RNA antisense regulation is solely responsible for the SOS inhibition, possibly explaining the discrepancy between the SOS inhibition phenotypes of the start codon mutation and the internal stop mutations observed by Weel-Sneve, 2008. TisB is conserved in Salmonella, but the previously annotated protein TisA is not conserved; tisA is not translated. Mutating the TisB translation start site blocks the toxic effect (Vogel, 2004). Previously tisA(ysdA) and tisB(ysdB) were fused into one hypothetical ORF by frameshift reconstruction, but this region was resequenced by De Henestrosa et al, 2000, who confirm the sequence is correct, so two separate ORFs were reinstated, but tisA has now been removed as a dubious annotation.

Description: Toxic peptide LdrA, in LDR-A repeat; proposed addiction module, with antisense sRNA rdlA
Comments: Null

Description: Toxic peptide LdrB, in LDR-B repeat; proposed addiction module, with antisense sRNA rdlB
Comments: Null

Description: Toxic peptide LdrC, in LDR-C repeat; proposed addiction module, with antisense sRNA rdlC
Comments: Null

Description: Toxic peptide LdrD, in LDR-D repeat; proposed addiction module, with antisense sRNA rdlD
Comments: Null

Description: Predicted periplasmic protein, function unknown
Comments: The first 22 aa of YjdP are predicted to be a type I signal peptide. yjdP is annotated on the opposite strand of the now defunct phnQ. Mature YjdP is predicted to consist 66% of just 4 aa: R,D,Q, E.

Description: Pseudogene, C-terminal fragment
Comments: The first 140 residues of YjhV are truncated by 1S911B. YjhV is homologous to a conserved oxidoreductase family of unknown function, such as E. carotovora SCRI1043 (UniProtKB: Q6D309).

Protein: response regulator inhibitor for tor operon
Description: Inhibitor of TorR response regulator, CPS-53/KpLE1 exisionase; blocks torABC transcription
Comments: The response regulator inhibitor TorI belongs to a new family of atypical excisionases pfam PF05930 Phage_AlpA. Phage origin.

Description: Function unknown
Comments: Null

Protein: e14 prophage; putative DNA-binding transcriptional regulator
Description: Cro-like repressor, e14 prophage
Comments: CroE(YmfT) is a C48Y variant of a putative Cro-like repressor protein from Shigella flexneri bacteriophage V.

Description: UPF0757 family protein, function unknown; glycine-rich
Comments: Null

Description: Function unknown
Comments: Immunoblots of chromosomal SPA-tagged YoaI failed to show a band, indicating that if yoaI is a gene, it is not expressed under the conditions tested (Hemm, 2008).

Description: Pseudogene, IS3 family transposase, ISX' in CP4-6 prophage; N-terminal fragment
Comments: InsX' is the N-terminus of an IS3 family transposase A encoded in the partial IS3-related ISX' element in the putative defective prophage CP4-6. InsX' matches 81 of the first 83 aa of Shigella flexneri ISEhe3-like 92 aa orfA transposase (UniProtKB: Q0T4M3). The ISEhe3 prototype in Pantoea agglomerans (GenBank: AF327445) encodes a 94 aa orfA transposase (UniProtKB: Q0T4M3) that is 90% identical (75/83 aa) to InsX'. The Q0T4M3 start codon corresponds to a GTG 2 codons upstream of the insX' ATG start codon. However this GTG does not have as good an RBS as the annotated insX' ATG start codon.

Description: Pseudogene, H repeat-associated protein, RhsC-linked; putative defective transposase
Comments: N-terminal domain fragment, matches first 79 residues of paralogs YhhI, YdcC, YbfD, pseudogene YbfL, and the more distant pseudogene paralog YncI. Putative transposase fragment.

Description: Pseudogene, N-terminal fragment
Comments: Full length YmjC is 212 aa, such as Z2446 of O157:H7 EDL933 (Q8X8L9); the first 46 residues, the YmjC fragment, are represented. 14 additional residues might be translated as KMQTTSGKKVIQDR, until a new stop codon, making a 60 residue YmjC translated pseudogene.

Protein: mRNA interferase toxin of the HicAB toxin-antitoxin system
Description: mRNA interferase toxin of hicAB TA pair; required for swarming phenotype
Comments: HicB is the antitoxin for the adjacent HicA toxin (Jorgensen, 2009).

Description: Function unknown, Qin prophage
Comments: Null

Description: Expressed protein, function unknown
Comments: An ORF homologous to yniD is unannotated in the Yersinia pseudotuberculosis genome. The second ATG is the conserved start and has a better RBS than the first ATG.

Description: Function unknown
Comments: Null

Description: Pseudogene, CP4-44 putative defective prophage; C-terminal fragment
Comments: YoeF is homologous to Clostridium tetani ethanolamine utilization gene eutP and Salmonella pduV. Predicted to be small GTPase family member. An example of an intact allele is SP: Q1RPC4.

Description: Predicted membrane protein, function unknown
Comments: YohO is expressed during exponential and stationary phase growth (Hemm, 2008).

Description: Pseudogene, C-terminal fragment, Transposase_31 family
Comments: YpaA' appears to be a C-terminal pseudogene fragment of a Transposase_31 family protein; an intact alelle of YpaA is UniProtKB L2Z6DZ.

Description: Pseudogene, exisonase fragment, CPS-53/KpLE1 prophage
Comments: YpdJ appears to be a pseudogene fragment encoding the N-terminus (minus the start codon) of an excisionase.

Description: Predicted periplasmic protein, function unknown
Comments: YicS has a Salmonella homolog. The first 21 aa of YicS are predicted to be a type I signal peptide. Pathogenicity island eip (EAEC strain 042) has inserted in the yicS-nepI intergenic region.

Description: UPF0386 family protein, function unknown
Comments: DUF2084 domain.

Protein: UV-inducible membrane toxin, DinQ-AgrB type I toxin-antitoxin system
Description: UV-inducible membrane toxin; DinQ-AgrB type I toxin-antitoxin system
Comments: DinQ is a 27 amino acid UV-inducible toxin that depolarizes the cell membrane, decreases ATP concentration, and affects nucleoid structure after UV exposure; DinQ and the agrB sRNA antitoxin constitute a novel type I-like toxin-antitoxin module that affects the cell response to UV-induced DNA damage; three lines of evidence demonstrate that the agrA sRNA antitoxin can neutralize the DinQ toxin: (1) an agrA deletion mutant is UV-sensitive, grows slowly, and is recessive, while the dinQ agrAB deletion strain is not UV-sensitive and grows normally (agrA single mutants have no phenotype, indicating that the agrA sRNA is inactive), (2) a clone with both agrA and dinQ does not display the UV-sensitivity caused by introducing a dinQ clone alone into wildtype cells, and (3) a dinQ clone cannot be introduced into an agrB mutant strain (Weel-Sneve, 2013). Immunoblots of chromosomal SPA-tagged DinQ failed to show a band, indicating that dinQ was not expressed under the conditions tested (Hemm, 2008; Hemm, 2010). LexA regulon. DinQ has a single predicted transmembrane helix.

Description: Expressed protein, function unknown, RpmJ paralog
Comments: YkgO is homologous to ribosomal protein L36.

Description: Pseudogene, oxidoreductase fragment
Comments: YkgP encodes the C-terminal 29 aa of a putative oxidoreductase. An intact version is present as Z0369 in O157:H7. The ykgP pseudogene is present in CFT073, annotated as small ORF C0408.

Protein: pseudogene, periplasmic solute binding protein homology
Description: Pseudogene, C-terminal solute binding domain
Comments: YzgL encodes the first 73/501 aa; a full length YzgL from EAEC strain 55989 is in SP B7L4V9. B7L4V9 is 505 aa and starts at an ATG 4 codons upstream, but this upstream start codon has no RBS associated with it. The C-terminal domain of full-length YzgL belongs to the PstS superfamily of solute binding domains found in both periplasmic binding proteins and in LysR family transcriptional regulators. The N-terminal domain of full-length YzgL has no CDD hits with E values < 0.01, but the two best hits suggest that the N-terminal domain is not a DNA-binding domain, but rather the permease component of a transport system, possibly an ion transporter. These CDD (at NCBI) hits are to (1) COG2998 (TupB), weakly predicting (E = 0.02) that this domain is related to the permease component of an ABC-type tungstate transport system, and (2) COG3263, weakly predicting (E = 0.10) that this domain is related to NhaP-type Na+/H+ and K+/H+ antiporters. Full-length YzgL may be a hydrid transporter with an N-terminal integral membrane domain and a C-terminal periplasmic solute-binding domain. Consistent with this interpretation, TMHMM predicts five transmembrane segments (TMs) in the first 203 residues and no TMs in the C-terminal 300 residues, whci is predicted by TMHMM to be outside (periplasmic). Signal-P HMM predicts a 22 signal peptide, but this may be a false positive due to an N-terminal transmembrane region. The yzgL' pseudogene is preceded by a putative attenuator structure.

Protein: pseudogene, prophage Rac integration site ttcA duplication
Description: Pseudogene, prophage Rac integration site ttcA duplication
Comments: The attachment site of Rac is a 26 bp repeat region flanking Rac: 1409923-1409948 and 1432983-1433008 (A J. Clark, pers. comm., 1998). The ends of Rac are marked at the left end of these repeat regions to delineate attB and attP. This Rac integration event is within the ttcA gene; the first 17 aa of TtcA are Rac-derived. The ttcC' pseudogene is a remnant 17 aa displaced from the original chromosomal ttcA gene. 25 bp encoding four mismatches immediately preceed the 26 bp exact repeat. Representative of both alleles are found in sequenced E. coli and Shigella genomes.

Protein: pseudogene, overlapping regulatory peptide, enables hokB
Description: Pseudogene, overlapping regulatory peptide, enables hokB; first 11 aa deleted by IS150 insertion
Comments: Insertion of IS150 caused a 39 bp deletion relative to the intact hokA/mokA locus in E. coli C, removing the starts of mokA and sokA.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, H repeat-associated protein; rhsA-linked
Comments: A frameshift at codon 28 and a stop codon at codon 24 were hypothetically reconstructed.

Protein: pseudogene, putative cryptic Rhs immunity protein
Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, predicted cryptic Rhs immunity protein; antitoxin in Rhs polymorphic toxin system
Comments: YibV' is a predicted cryptic antitoxin, or immunity protein (Pfam: PF15596), against an Rhs family polymorphic toxin. YibV' has been reconstructed, correcting a frameshift to match other E. coli strain alleles by removing an A after codon 109, producing a 145 aa protein sequence.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, rhsA-linked
Comments: A frameshift was hypothetically reconstructed by adding an N after codon 28; YibW' is a C-terminal fragment matching the unique C-terminal extension of the S. sonnei Rhs family protein Ss046.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, CP4-44 putative defective prophage; N-terminal fragment
Comments: Transposase homolog, IS4 family, transposase family 25. Five inframe stop codons were replaced by Xs. A frameshift corrected at codon 146 is marked with an X.

Description: Pseudogene, CP4-44 putative defective prophage; C-terminal fragment
Comments: Homologous to C-terminus of 20 family transposases, like E. coli E24377A Q27V67. Inframe stops at codons 5 and 36 are represented by Xs in the reconstructed protein sequence.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, novel zinc finger family protein
Comments: An inframe stop codon 30 was hypothetically reconstructed as an X. Only Gram-negative family member.

Description: Pseudogene, C-terminal fragment of a putative dehydrogenase
Comments: An intact allele is putative dehydrogenase Z0377 of E. coli O157:H7 (Q8X6G0).

Description: DUF3950 family protein, DLP12 prophage
Comments: YlcI belongs to the DUF3950 family (Pfam PF13132) of putative phage proteins.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, predicted acetyltransferase
Comments: An inframe stop codon at position 44 was translated as an X for the reconstruction. An intact version of YjhZ is present in Escherichia sp. 3_2_53FAA as ESAG_039(). GNAT N-acetyltransferase family.

Description: Pseudogene, N-terminal fragment
Comments: Intact alleles of YicT have been called RhuM (Q1R4S5) and ErhM (Q1AP19). Orthologous to Salmonella virulence island SPI-3 gene rhuM. yicT also has small internal deletions.

Description: Uncharacterized protein
Comments: ymgI and ymgJ are adjacent, divergently oriented, and similar to one another at their N- and C-termini (Hemm, 2008). It is possible that ymgI and ymgJ are not translated into proteins.

Description: Uncharacterized protein
Comments: ymgI and ymgJ are adjacent, divergently oriented, and similar to one another at their N- and C-termini (Hemm, 2008). It is possible that ymgI and ymgJ are not translated into proteins.

Protein: lethality reduction protein, putative inner membrane protein
Description: Lethality reduction protein, predicted membrane protein
Comments: Mutations in ykfM have a hyperlethality phenotype when cells are stressed; YkfM is a protein that reduces the lethal effects of stress (Han, 2010). YkfM has three transmembrane helicies predicted.

Description: Pseudogene reconstruction, P4-like integrase remnant; C-terminal fragment
Comments: A stop codon at postion 14 and a frameshift at codon 29 were hypothetically reconstructed with Xs.

Description: Pseudogene, N-terminal remnant, YdiA family
Comments: YdiA/UPF0085 Family.

Description: Pseudogene, C-terminal remnant
Comments: A deletion has apparently removed the N-terminal regions of ysaC and ysaD. An intact version of this region is present in O157:H7 with three genes: a putative AraC-trpe transcriptional regulator Z5000:Q8XDK9(ysaC), a putative permease Z5001:Q8XDK7 and a putative glycosidase Z5002:Q7A9W5(ysaD). Apparently the putative glycosidase was also deleted from K-12.

Description: Pseudogene, internal sequence remnant
Comments: A deletion has apparently removed the N-terminal regions of ysaC and ysaD. An intact version of this region is present in O157:H7 with three genes: a putative AraC-type transcriptional regulator Z5000:Q8XDK9(ysaC), a putative permease Z5001:Q8XDK7 and a putative glycosidase Z5002:Q7A9W5(ysaD). Apparently the putative glycosidase was also deleted from K-12. The last C-terminal residues of YsaD are also missing.

Description: Predicted periplasmic protein, function unknown
Comments: The first 29 aa of YjbT are predicted to be a type I signal peptide. yjbT is restricted to E. coli genomes. The convergent yjbH_yjbT interval has a predicted Rho-independent bi-directional terminator.

Description: UPF0509 family protein
Comments: yciT(deoT) and yciZ(deoL) are co-transcribed and constitute an operon (Elgrably-Weiss, 2006). deoT stands for deoR-Type based on its homology to DeoR, and deoL stands for deoT leader peptide (Elgrably-Weiss, 2006). deo is reserved for genes involved in deoxyribose metabolism; deoT and deoL are designated as synonyms. There is no evidence that YciZ(DeoL) acts as a regulatory leader peptide. Supportive evidence for YciZ(DeoL) translation has been obtained using mass spectrometry analysis optimized for small protein detection (Muller, 2010).

Description: Stationary phase expressed protein, function unknown
Comments: Predicted TM segment.

Description: Predicted membrane protein, function unknown
Comments: An alternate start site 12 codons upstream is now predicted because an upstream YmiA peptide was detected using shotgun proteomics (Krug, 2013). The upstream start site has a poor RBS but some additional amino acid similarity while the internal site has a better RBS. YmiA has one predicted transmembrane helix, residues 31-53.

Description: Expressed protein, function unknown
Comments: Predicted TM segment.

Description: RyhB-regulated Fur regulatory leader peptide
Comments: The ryhB sRNA is an antisense regulator of uof translation, which is coupled to the downstream fur gene translation; the fur RBS is occluded by 5' mRNA secondary structure, which is opened by uof translation (Vecerek, 2007). A ribosome binding toeprint to the uof translation initiation region was demonstrated, although uof does not have a canonical RBS (Vecerek, 2007).

Protein: two-component system connector membrane protein, EvgSA to PhoQP
Description: Two-component system connector protein, EvgSA to PhoQP; TCS regulon connector; EvgSA-regulated membrane protein that activates the PhoQP regulon
Comments: yneN(b1500) has been renamed as safA for "sensor associating factor" (Itoh, 2009). A safA(b1500) mutant has 3-fold lower acid resistance and is regulated by EvgA as the first gene in the safA(b1500)-ydeO operon (Masuda, 2002). safA(b1500) is activated by EvgA to stimulate genes downstream of PhoP in a PhoP-dependent manner by binding to PhoQ in the membrane (Eguchi, 2007). SafA has a single predicted central transmembrane helix.

Description: Inhibitor of glucose uptake
Comments: SgrT is encoded within the sgrS sRNA and translated during glucose-phosphate stress; overproduction prevents inducer exclusion and inhibits glucose uptake, probably by interfering with PtsG activity (Wadler, 2007).

Description: Acid-inducible small membrane-associated protein
Comments: The azuC mRNA was previously identified as sRNA IS092(isrB) (Chen, 2002). azuC gene name and identification, J. Miranda-Rios, personal communication (Hemm, 2008).

Description: Toxic membrane protein, in SIBd repeat
Comments: sibD sRNA is an antisense regulator of IbsD (Fozo, 2008). IbsC, and probably all Ibs proteins, depolarize membranes (Fozo, 2008).

Description: Toxic membrane protein, in SIBc repeat
Comments: sibC sRNA is an antisense regulator of IbsC (Fozo, 2008). IbsC, and probably all Ibs proteins, depolarize membranes (Fozo, 2008).

Description: Toxic membrane protein, in SIBe repeat
Comments: sibE sRNA is an antisense regulator of IbsE (Fozo, 2008). IbsC, and probably all Ibs proteins, depolarize membranes (Fozo, 2008).

Description: Toxic membrane protein, in SIBa repeat
Comments: sibA sRNA is an antisense regulator of IbsA (Fozo, 2008). IbsC, and probably all Ibs proteins, depolarize membranes (Fozo, 2008).

Description: Toxic membrane protein, in SIBb repeat
Comments: sibB sRNA is an antisense regulator of IbsB (Fozo, 2008). IbsC, and probably all Ibs proteins, depolarize membranes (Fozo, 2008).

Comments: Predicted TM segment.

Comments: Null

Comments: An internal 290 codons of ymjD' has apparently been deleted (represented by an X at position 19 of the reconstructed remnant protein sequence) leaving codons 1-18 fused in frame to codons 309-310; an intact 310 aa allele is in E. coli strain E24377A (NCBI: 157081112) personal communication, Eric Neeno-Eckwall (11/08). Apparently, YmjD' is an expressed pseudogene remnant (Hemm, 2008).

Comments: YpdK is a highly expressed membrane protein (Hemm, 2008).

Comments: YqcG is expressed during exponential phase growth (Hemm, 2008). YqcG is needed for full resistance to cell membrane stress (Hobbs, 2010).

Comments: Null

Comments: Predicted TM segment.
